bug.short_desc: Switch from Requires kernel-devel to kernel-devel-uname-r
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: When installing the dkms package, there is a kernel-devel dependency. But since any kernel-devel varriant (PAE/lpae/etc) has the kernel-devel virtual provide, it's not possible to prefer kernel-devel over kernel-debug-devel.
I sugguest to drop the kernel-devel virtual provide in the kernel package and to use the right virtual as kernel-devel-uname-r
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): current dkms version in devel
How reproducible: dnf install dkms
Actual results: kernel-devel-debug is installed
Expected results: It should install the kernel-devel matching the kernel (or at least the statistically best candidate).
Additional info: see also rhbz#1420754

I've added kernel-devel-uname-r instead of kernel-devel and the weak dependency as you suggested at:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1420754#c0 https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1421105#c2
But it still pulls in kernel-debug-devel by default, as you said. Will release it with the next snapshot drop, is that ok?
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 26 development cycle. Changing version to '26'.

So the weak dependency is not working. On an i386 system with kernel-PAE-devel the weak dependency pulls in also the the "base" kernel-devel:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1436840
I've left the kernel-uname-devel-r requirement and removed the weak dependency.
